snippet: Israel arrested 150 people, most of them leaders of the militant Islamic movement Hamas, and Aziz Dweik, a Hebron resident who is speaker of the Palestinian Parliament.
abstract: Crackdown in Hebron by Israeli troops in wake of kidnapping of three Israeli teenagers is being described by Palestinians in the West Bank as siege; Israel has arrested 150 people, most of them leaders of the militant Islamic movement Hamas, and Aziz Dweik, speaker of the inert Palestinian Parliament.

byline.contributor: Nayef Hashlamoun and Said Ghazali contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Israel arrested 150 people, most of them leaders of the militant Islamic movement Hamas, and Aziz Dweik, a Hebron resident who is speaker of the Palestinian Parliament.

headline.main: Tensions Mount as Troops Scour Hebron in Search for Missing Youths
headline.print_headline: Tensions Mount as Troops Scour Hebron in Search for Missing Youths
